newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian index up on industry, insurance shares.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian index up on industry, insurance shares.

text.p: Norway's stock market was spearheaded by buoyant offshore and insurance shares to hit a record close on Thursday in heavy trade worth 1.1 billion crowns.

The Total share index gained 0.75 percent to close at 949.77 points, reversing Wednesday's losses. They had resulted partly from a slump in Saga Petroleum shares after the oil company bought British-based Santa Fe Exploration for $1.23 billion,
Investors, who at first were negative to the acquisition, turned positive following news that Saga would get tax breaks under Norwegian law, dealers said.
Saga's A share climbed 7.46 percent to 108 crowns and the B share finished 6.42 percent higher at 99.50 crowns.
Saga accounted for 323 million crowns of total business.
Industrial conglomerate Norsk Hydro was the second most traded share at 106 million crowns and closed 0.76 percent up at 333.50 crowns.
Insurance company Storebrand was another winner, finishing 1.06 percent higher at 38 crowns.
The industry index was up 0.97 percent, the insurance rose 0.95 percent while the shipping and banking indexes were flat.
